channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Want a seat at this synagogue for the High Holidays? You have to register to vote first
item.description: A Brooklyn synagogue has taken an unusual step by requiring congregants to show proof of voter registration in order to secure seats for High Holidays. Their biggest concern? The city's mayoral seat.
item.content:encoded:
A Brooklyn synagogue has taken an unusual step by requiring congregants to show proof of voter registration in order to secure seats for High Holidays. Their biggest concern? The city's mayoral seat.

(Image credit: Bebeto Matthews)
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Trump, in major shift, suggests Ukraine can win back territory long held by Russia
item.description: Last month, President Trump said Ukraine needed to be open to giving up some of its territory in peace talks with Russia. But those talks haven't happened. Now, he says Ukraine could win it all back.
item.content:encoded:
Last month, President Trump said Ukraine needed to be open to giving up some of its territory in peace talks with Russia. But those talks haven't happened. Now, he says Ukraine could win it all back.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: MLB will allow players to challenge balls and strikes starting in 2026
item.description: With a tap of their head, players will be able to trigger an automated review when they disagree with an umpire's call. In spring training this year, just over half of challenges were successful.
item.content:encoded:
With a tap of their head, players will be able to trigger an automated review when they disagree with an umpire's call. In spring training this year, just over half of challenges were successful.

(Image credit: Dylan Buell)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: When it comes to Tylenol, what are parents to do?
item.description: The science on Tylenol and autism isn't clear, despite President Trump's claims. Here's what parents need to know to make their own decisions about acetaminophen.
item.content:encoded:
The science on Tylenol and autism isn't clear, despite President Trump's claims. Here's what parents need to know to make their own decisions about acetaminophen.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Nell Greenfieldboyce

item.title: World health officials reject Trump's claims that Tylenol is linked to autism
item.description: The President says pregnant women should stay away from Tylenol due to possible autism link. World health authorities strongly disagree, say the drug is safe in pregnancy.
item.content:encoded:
The President says pregnant women should stay away from Tylenol due to possible autism link. World health authorities strongly disagree, say the drug is safe in pregnancy.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: Jury convicts Ryan Routh on all charges in attempted assassination of Donald Trump
item.description: Jurors convicted Routh on five charges, including last year's attempted assassination of Trump as he golfed at his South Florida course. Routh represented himself in court and faces life in prison.
item.content:encoded:
Jurors convicted Routh on five charges, including last year's attempted assassination of Trump as he golfed at his South Florida course. Routh represented himself in court and faces life in prison.

(Image credit: Lothar Speer)
item.dc:creator: Greg Allen

item.title: You can now experience Björk's heartbreak in VR
item.description: Vulnicura VR Remastered revisits a project the Icelandic pop artist debuted a decade ago, now reimagined with advanced technology.
item.content:encoded:
Vulnicura VR Remastered, the latest iteration of a VR project the Icelandic pop artist started working on almost a decade ago.'/>

Vulnicura VR Remastered revisits a project the Icelandic pop artist debuted a decade ago, now reimagined with advanced technology.

(Image credit: PulseJet Studios)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Trump cancels meeting with Democrats as prospects for shutdown increase
item.description: President Trump called off a planned Thursday meeting with top Hill Democrats to discuss a possible deal to avoid a shutdown. He called Democrats' demands "unserious." Democrats say he chickened out.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump called off a planned Thursday meeting with top Hill Democrats to discuss a possible deal to avoid a shutdown. He called Democrats' demands "unserious." Democrats say he chickened out.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Deirdre Walsh

item.title: After fireworks caused her dog to panic, a stranger offered them a ride home
item.description: Lara Friedman was walking her large rottweiler on July 4 when fireworks went off. Her dog went into panic mode. Then a stranger offered to help, ensuring both got home safely.
item.content:encoded:
Lara Friedman was walking her large rottweiler on July 4 when fireworks went off. Her dog went into panic mode. Then a stranger offered to help, ensuring both got home safely.

(Image credit: Friedman family photo)
item.dc:creator: Autumn Barnes

item.title: The surprisingly lucrative business of making a list of 500 stocks
item.description: What even is the business of the S&P 500, and how does it make so much money?
item.content:encoded:
What even is the business of the S&P 500, and how does it make so much money?

(Image credit: Richard Drew/AP)
item.dc:creator: Alex Mayyasi
